com.bham.bd.components.environment

Class GameMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bham.bd.components.environment.GameMap

  • public class GameMap
extends Object

    Game Map

    This class takes care of the map the current game session uses. It generates an appropriate map, adds obstacles and respawning triggers to the game, initializes home and enemy territories and sets up a graph. Note: the class itself only passes triggers that come along from the JSON file to the controller. It also does not check for obstacle intersection, MapDivision does that for it - this class only takes care of their visuals.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameMap

        public GameMap(MapType mapType)
        Constructs the map for the active game session. All obstacles are from a JSON file parsed with MapLoader.
        Parameters:
        mapType - type of map to be loaded - it contains a path for the JSON file

    • Method Detail

      • initParams

        private void initParams(MapLoader mapLoader)
        Initializes the size parameters of the map
        Parameters:
        mapLoader - map loader that will provide the information about the loaded map

      • initElements

        private void initElements(MapLoader mapLoader)
        Initializes (loads) interactive and non-interactive obstacles as well as constant triggers
        • Noninteractive - obstacles that don't affect any entities in the game
        • Interactive - obstacles that do affect game entities in some way (hit-boxes are considered)
        Parameters:
        mapLoader - map loader that will provide all the generated obstacles and triggers

      • initAreas

        private void initAreas(MapLoader mapLoader)
        Initializes spawning areas and the home territory

        This method gets the center points of appropriate areas and creates a circle representing the hit-box of those territories. It sets the circle as big as it can get without touching other areas (those that do not belong to the same group) and applies padding to it by reducing its radius by GameCharacter.MAX_RADIUS property. This is to ensure that, if a character is spawned on the edge of that territory, it does not collide with interactive obstacles.

        Parameters:
        mapLoader - map loader which will provide the territory locations

      • initGraph

        public void initGraph(MapLoader mapLoader)
        Initializes the graph for the current map considering triggers locations
        Parameters:
        mapLoader - map loader that will provide the information about constant triggers the graph can point to

      • getWidth

        public static int getWidth()
        Gets map's width (tileWidth * numTilesX)
        Returns:
        current map's width or 0 if no map is loaded

        Returns:
        SparseGraph generated for this map

      • getEnemySpawnAreas

        public Circle[] getEnemySpawnAreas()
        Gets all the areas where the enemies can be spawned
        Returns:
        an array of circles representing areas where at any point int it an enemy can be spawned

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates all the obstacles

        Interactive obstacles are removed if they don't exist. Both interactive and non-interactive obstacles are updated but here collision is not handled (e.g. obstacle can update its frame picture).

      • renderBottomLayer

        public void renderBottomLayer(GraphicsContext gc)
        Renders all the obstacles as the bottom layer of all the entities
        Parameters:
        gc - graphics context on which the the obstacles will be rendered

      • renderTopLayer

        public void renderTopLayer(GraphicsContext gc)
        Renders those obstacles which are at the top layer of all the entities
        Parameters:
        gc - graphics context on which the the obstacles will be rendered

      • renderGraph

        public void renderGraph(GraphicsContext gc,
                        ArrayList<GameCharacter> entities)
        Renders graph (its nodes) and active points of the entities
        Parameters:
        gc - graphics context on which the nodes will be rendered
        entities - entities which will allow active nodes (red) to be rendered at their location

      • renderTerritories

        public void renderTerritories(GraphicsContext gc)
        Renders the circular areas around the specific territories
        Parameters:
